name: course-catalog-api

scripts.about:babel-node-ts: //// This command is used to run Typescript files on the fly. Mainly used in other commands, not standalone
scripts.about:dev: //// Runs the API server - the course catalog API
scripts.about:dev:notifs: //// Runs the API server along with the notifications server
scripts.about:scrape: //// Scrapes ALL of the latest class data from Banner
scripts.about:scrape:custom: //// Runs a scrape with some custom configuration. Read the backend docs for more info
scripts.about:updater: //// Scrapes frequently-changing class data from Banner (eg. seats free)
scripts.about:resetIndex: //// Deletes the Elasticsearch indexes and re-creates them. This will discard all existing data
scripts.about:resetIndex:noLoss: //// Resets the Elasticsearch indexes without losing their data. This allows us to update the index mapping (which can't be done directly while there is data in the index)
scripts.about:populateES: //// Updates Elasticsearch to contain all the data we currently have in the database
scripts.about:dev:docker: //// Creates the Docker containers needed to run the API locally
scripts.about:dev:docker:server: //// Experimental: runs the FULL STACK (ie. including searchneu) via Docker
scripts.about:db:migrate: //// Applies Prisma migrations. Think of migrations as `git` for databases - this allows us to change the structure of the DB in a way that can be easily replicated by all developers (and in production)
scripts.about:db:refresh: //// Generates Typescript files based on the schema of the database
scripts.about:lint: //// Ensures that our code follows best practices
scripts.about:tsc: //// Runs TSC (because of our config, this will NOT compile the files, just typecheck them)
scripts.about:test: //// Runs a basic suite of unit and integration tests
scripts.about:dbtest: //// Runs tests interacting with our database. Must have the Docker containers running. This won't touch live data - it will create and teardown a temporary database.
scripts.about:unittest: //// Runs unit tests. Does not need db, elasticsearch, spun up. Does not need the Docker containers to be running.
scripts.build: rm -rf dist && mkdir -p dist && babel --extensions '.js,.ts' . -d dist/ --copy-files --ignore node_modules --ignore .git --include-dotfiles && rm -rf dist/.git
scripts.about:prod:scrape: //// Runs the scrapers (same as `yarn scrape`, but on the compiled project)
scripts.about:prod: //// Runs the API (same as `yarn dev`, but on the compiled project)
scripts.about:prod:updater: //// Runs the updater (same as `yarn updater`, but on the compiled project)
scripts.about:prod:db:migrate: //// Runs the Prisma migrations (same as `yarn db:migrate`, but on the compiled project)

about:engines: This helps us ensure that only specific versions of Node are used to run this project
Older versions may lead to unexpected errors due to dependency issues, etc.
